summary: Request to document SDK errors in API docs and enable type-safe error handling via error classes. Users need to discover which errors methods can throw and use instanceof for error type checking instead of runtime discovery.
userImpact: Users cannot easily discover which errors SDK methods can throw or properly type-check errors at runtime, leading to incomplete error handling in applications.
rootCause: SDK errors are not documented in API docs and lack proper error class hierarchy for isinstance checking.
proposedFix: Add error classes for all SDK error codes and document which errors each method can throw in the API documentation.
workaround: Manual runtime discovery of errors and string-based error classification in user code.
resolutionDetails: Addressed through cross-SDK effort to add error classes (WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedError, WorkflowNotFoundError already added in PR #468) and document possible errors by method.
keyQuote: Be able to see in a method's API docs which error types it can throw. Be able to use instanceof like this
